name: libr-bridge/R.mjs
R
description: Class for accessing R via libR.

name: constructor
description: Constructor function for class R

name: __initializeRfunc
description:
Load some R functions.
Please do not call manually.

name: isInitialized
description: Check whether R class is globally initialized or not.

return.description: Returns true if R is already loaded.

name: GlobalEnv
description: Acquire global environment in R.

name: libR
description: Initialized libR object for accessing R.

name: func
description:
Acquire bridging function to access R function.
Functions receive JavaScript value, and returns JavaScript compatible objects.

name: func_raw
description:
Acquire bridging function to access R function.
This function doesn't convert to/from SEXP.
Receives SEXPWrap, and returns SEXPWrap. Please use carefully.

name: __func_sexp
description:
Find functions in R environment.
Please do not call this function manually.

name: __RFuncBridge_raw
description:
Bridging function for R function.
This bridging function doesn't handle SEXP.
Please do not call this function manually.

name: __RFuncBridge
description:
Bridging function for R function.
Please do not call this function manually.

name: eval_raw
description: Execute R code.

return.description: SEXPWrap object of returned value. Returns undefined on error.

name: __eval_langsxp
description: Execute R code with LANGSXP

name: eval_direct
description:
Execute R code without error handling. App crashes when execution/parse failure.
Please use this function with care.

return.description: SEXPWrap object of returned value. Returns undefined on error.

name: eval
description: Execute R code.
examples: let value = R.eval("sum(c(1, 2, 3))")		// value will be 6

return.description: JavaScript compatible object of returned value.

name: evalWithTry
description: Execute R code with R try. This is more safe than {@link R#eval}.

return.description: Returned value. Returns undefined on error.

name: getVar
description: Acquire value of R variable

name: getVarNames
description: Acquire names attribute of R variable

return.description: Associated name attribute for the specified R variable. If no name, undefined will be returned.

name: setVar
description: Set value to R variable

params.name: value
params.description: Value you want to set to variable.

name: setVarNames
description: Set names attribute to R variable

params.name: value
params.description: Value you want to set to names attributes

name: overrideShowMessage
description: Use your own console input/output instead of R's default one.

name: overrideReadConsole
description: Use your own console input/output instead of R's default one.

name: overrideWriteConsole
description: Use your own console input/output instead of R's default one.

name: overrideBusy
description: Set callback on R's computation.

name: release
description: Finish using R.

name: range
description:
Python like range function.
Be careful, this is not R ':' operator
range(0, 3) == [0, 1, 2], which is not eq. to 0:3

return.description: value in a <= x < b. range(0, 3) == [0, 1, 2]

name: libr-bridge/RObject.mjs
RArray
description:
JavaScript class for R Array type.
Please use appropriate deriverd class if possible.

name: RFactor
description:
JavaScript class for R Factor type.
A factor has numerical(integer) array with keys.

name: constructor
description: Create a factor.

params.name: ordered
params.description: {boolean}	If true, this factor is ordered factor (nominal)

name: RList
description:
JavaScript class for R Data Frame type.
With a data frame, we can  is able to contain different type of items.

name: libr-bridge/SEXPWrap.mjs
__initializeWithValue
description: Initialize this instance with specified value.

name: protect
description: Protect this SEXP

name: unprotect
description: Unprotect SEXPs

name: preserve
description: Preserve this SEXP. Please use protect() if you can.

name: release
description: Release preserved SEXP. protect()ed SEXP should be released with unprotect()

name: isList
description: Return true if this SEXP is List.

name: isVector
description: Return true if this SEXP is Vector. Please note single scalar value in R is vector.

name: length
description: Return the length of vector.

name: isNull
description: Return true if this SEXP is null.

name: SEXPSize
description: Return sizeof(SEXP) in byte.

name: setAttribute
description: set attr of this variable.

name: getAttribute
description: get attr of this variable.

name: _getAttribute_raw
description: get attr SEXP of this variable.

name: libr-bridge/develop.mjs
libr-bridge/example.mjs
libr-bridge/index.mjs
libr-bridge/libR.mjs
SEXPTYPE
description: R SEXP type enums

types: {"NILSXP": *, "SYMSXP": number, "LISTSXP": number, "CLOSXP": number, "ENVSXP": number, "PROMSXP": number, "LANGSXP": number, "SPECIALSXP": number, "BUILTINSXP": number, "CHARSXP": number, "LGLSXP": number, "INTSXP": number, "REALSXP": number, "CPLXSXP": number, "STRSXP": number, "DOTSXP": number, "ANYSXP": number, "VECSXP": number, "EXPRSXP": number, "BCODESXP": number, "EXTPTRSXP": number, "WEAKREFSXP": number, "RAWSXP": number, "S4SXP": number, "NEWSXP": number, "FREESXP": number, "FUNSXP": number}

name: createLibR
description: Load libR from appropriate place.

unknown.tagValue: libR object which enables access to dynamic link library.

params.name: r_path
params.description:
"auto" (default) || "environment" || "system" || "buildin" || path to R_HOME
						"auto" - try "environment" -> "system" -> "buildin"
						"environment" - use environmental R_HOME and LD_LIBRARY_PATH. libr-bridge handles nothing.
						"system" - find system installed R
						"buildin" - (NOT IMPLEMENTED) use redistributed binary attached with libr-bridge-bin

return.description: libR object which enables access to dynamic link library.

content:
libr-bridge
========================================

![Travis CI](https://travis-ci.org/kcrt/libr-bridge.svg?branch=master)

Bridging module: JavaScript < - > R

![](./logo.png)


Sorry! It's under development.
----------------------------------------
  * Some important features including factor, dataframe, console handling, S3/S4 object handling and expression are not supported yet!
  * Incompatible API changes may be held.
  * Please do not use in the production environment until specifications are fixed.
  * Pull requests are always welcome.

What is libr-bridge?
----------------------------------------

[**libr-bridge**](https://github.com/kcrt/libr-bridge) is a very powerful npm package which enables you to use R function/statistical method in Node.js environment.

[R (The R Foundation, Vienna, Austria)](https://www.r-project.org) is a free software environment for statistical computing. With **libr-bridge**, you can use function in R as if they were JavaScript native function.

How to Use
----------------------------------------

Following samples and **libr-bridge** are written with ECMAScript 6 modules syntex (import/export).
Please use [**esm**](https://github.com/standard-things/esm) or **--experimental-modules**.

```javascript
let r = new R();

const arrA = [1.00, 3.36, 8.01, 1.22, 3.74, 2.43, 7.95, 8.32, 7.45, 4.36];
const arrB = [1.04, 3.65, 6.82, 1.46, 2.70, 2.49, 7.48, 8.28, 8.93, 5.63];

/* Some functions are already loaded to libr-bridge */
console.log("Mean of arrA: " + r.mean(arrA));
console.log("Mean of arrB: " + r.mean(arrB));
console.log("Peason's correlation coefficient: " + r.cor(arrA, arrB));

/* You can pass data to R */
r.setVar("a", arrA);

/* And data can be used in R */
console.log(r.eval('sum(a)'));
r.eval('b <- a / 2');
console.log(r.eval('b'));

/* You can receive data from R */
let b = r.getVar("b");

/* Execute complex command with eval. */
r.eval(`
	myfactorial <- function(x) {
		if (x == 0) {
			return(1)
		} else {
			return(x * myfactorial(x - 1))
		}
	}
`);
let factorial_50 = r.func("myfactorial")(50);
console.log(factorial_50);
```

API
----------------------------------------
### `Document`
Please see doc directory.

Depending package
----------------------------------------
### npm
1. [node-ffi: Node.js Foreign Function Interface](https://github.com/node-ffi/node-ffi)
1. [ref * Turn Buffer instances into "pointers"](https://tootallnate.github.io/ref/)
1. [arian/Complex: Calculations with Complex Numbers in JavaScript](https://github.com/arian/Complex)

My TODO list
----------------------------------------

 - [x] Factor
 - [ ] Dataframe
 - [x] Console handling
 - [ ] S3 class
 - [ ] S4 class
 - [ ] Graphic handling

Author information
----------------------------------------
Programmed by kcrt (TAKAHASHI, Kyohei)
http://profile.kcrt.net/
	
License
----------------------------------------
	Copyright  2017 kcrt (TAKAHASHI, Kyohei)
	Released under the MIT license
	http://opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php

Reference
----------------------------------------
### English
1. [R Internals](https://cran.r-project.org/doc/manuals/r-release/R-ints.html)
1. [R internals (by Hadley)](https://github.com/hadley/r-internals)
1. [Advanced R by Hadley Wickham](http://adv-r.had.co.nz)
	- You can buy [Physical copy](https://www.amazon.com/dp/1466586966) of this material. Especially recommended!
1. [Rccp: Seamless R anc C++ Integration](https://github.com/RcppCore/Rcpp)
1. [Rcpp documentation](http://dirk.eddelbuettel.com/code/rcpp/html/index.html)
1. [Rcpp for everyone (Masaki E. Tsuda)](https://teuder.github.io/rcpp4everyone_en/)

### Japanese
1. [R Ver.1.7.0](https://cran.r-project.org/doc/contrib/manuals-jp/R-intro-170.jp.pdf)
1. [R Ver.1.1.0 DRAFT](https://cran.r-project.org/doc/contrib/manuals-jp/R-lang.jp.v110.pdf)
1. [R Ver2.1.0](https://cran.r-project.org/doc/contrib/manuals-jp/R-exts.jp.pdf)
1. [R Hadley Wickham (),   ()](http://amzn.to/2xhIZtg) 
1. [Rcpp (Masaki E. Tsuda)](https://teuder.github.io/rcpp4everyone_ja/)
name: ./README.md

content:
{
    "name": "libr-bridge",
    "version": "0.1.6",
    "description": "Use libR from node.js",
    "main": "index",
    "scripts": {
        "doc": "rm -R doc; ./node_modules/.bin/esdoc; cp ./logo.png doc",
        "test": "./node_modules/.bin/mocha-esm test/*.mjs",
        "debug-test": "DEBUG=libr-bridge:* ./node_modules/.bin/mocha-esm  test/*.mjs",
        "run-develop": "DEBUG=libr-bridge:* node -r esm develop.mjs",
        "debug-develop": "node --inspect-brk -r esm develop.mjs",
		"lint": "./node_modules/.bin/eslint --ext .js,.mjs ."
    },
    "repository": {
        "type": "git",
        "url": "https://github.com/kcrt/libr-bridge.git"
    },
    "author": "kcrt",
    "license": "MIT",
    "dependencies": {
        "Complex": "^3.0.0",
        "esm": "^3.0.62",
        "ffi": "https://github.com/kcrt/node-ffi.git",
        "node-gyp": "^3",
        "ref-array": "^1",
        "ref-struct": "^1.1.0",
        "windows-registry": "^0.1.3"
    },
    "devDependencies": {
        "esdoc": "^1",
        "esdoc-ecmascript-proposal-plugin": "^1.0.0",
        "esdoc-importpath-plugin": "^1",
        "esdoc-standard-plugin": "^1",
        "eslint": "^5.2.0",
        "mocha": "^3",
        "mocha-esm": "^1.0.2"
    }
}
name: package.json
